item.title: Shannon
item.description:
Submitted on: Tuesday, 22 November 2016, 9:53 AM

Submitted by: Kathryn Strilchuk

HUB APPLICANT AGREEMENT 2016‐2017  

The FSD HUB School System provides students the opportunity to explore their educational programming through on‐line learning.  The FSD Hub allows the students to work at their own pace providing flexibility in their  timetables and the option to continue their education while travelling or working. 

 

Last name: Morris   First Name: Shannon  Grade: 11

School:

Student email:  Student Phone cell:

Does the student have an IPP(Please attach if relevant)?) No

Parent contact information (Name, phone, email):

Term: Semester 2 - Complete in June

In which courses has student registered? 
English 20-1

Students must provide proof of enrollment before entering the HUB. Student will attend classes in the HUB regularly and punctually during the following periods, blocks or times:

 

B block semester 2

Why has the student chosen the hub (ie: Flexibility, travelling, etc)?

What strengths, challenges or other history should the teacher be aware of?

Please attach any relevant documentation here:

The School Act, Section 12 (2011) Part 1, Section 7 states “A student shall conduct his or herself to as to reasonably comply with the following code of conduct:

 

· be diligent in pursuing the student’s studies; 
· attend school regularly and punctually; 
· cooperate fully with everyone authorized by the board to provide education programs and other services; 
· comply with the rules of the school; 
· account to the student’s  teacher for the student’s conduct; 
· respect the rights of others.” 

Failure to meet attendance expectations will result in withdrawal from the course. The student will also 
be responsible for the return of any textbooks or loan items.

The HUB is an online, semi-independent learning environment. I understand that this will require a greater degree of focus and self discipline than in the regular classroom.

 

_____________________________________

(if required)

Submitted by: Jeff Mason

HUB APPLICANT AGREEMENT 2016‐2017  

The FSD HUB School System provides students the opportunity to explore their educational programming through on‐line learning.  The FSD Hub allows the students to work at their own pace providing flexibility in their  timetables and the option to continue their education while travelling or working. 

 

Last name: Rogers   First Name: Katie  Grade: 12

School:

Student email:  Student Phone cell:

Does the student have an IPP(Please attach if relevant)?) 

Parent contact information (Name, phone, email):

Term: Full Year - Complete in June

In which courses has student registered? 
English 30-1

Students must provide proof of enrollment before entering the HUB. Student will attend classes in the HUB regularly and punctually during the following periods, blocks or times:

 

D Block, non attendance:

I have met with Katie and think that it is in her best interest to move from ELA 30-1 with ADLC to ELA 30-1 in the HUB. She came to me to talk about her frustrations with ADLC, which she started over the summer. She is advocating for her own learning, and in my opionion, has the competencies needed to be successful in the HUB. 

Her and I went over the texts and assessments covered in ADLC and made a plan to move forward accordingly. He intention is to use her D block spare to work on the course, with the intention of finishing in June, but with the option of finishing in January or April if possible. ​

I think that she represents the 'exceptional cases' that we have discussed, and I think that as a school, the best way to ensure that she achieves the success she desires is to make this transition.

I have asked her to complete the unit she is working on in ADLC and to write their midterm both as practice and as a diagnostic tool for me to better assess her current skill level.

I have asked Jeff to fill out a registration form for her, and for Karen to add her to the course upon completion of that form. 

Thanks,

 

Why has the student chosen the hub (ie: Flexibility, travelling, etc)?

· be diligent in pursuing the student’s studies; 
· attend school regularly and punctually; 
· cooperate fully with everyone authorized by the board to provide education programs and other services; 
· comply with the rules of the school; 
· account to the student’s  teacher for the student’s conduct; 
· respect the rights of others.” 

Failure to meet attendance expectations will result in withdrawal from the course. The student will also 
be responsible for the return of any textbooks or loan items.

The HUB is an online, semi-independent learning environment. I understand that this will require a greater degree of focus and self discipline than in the regular classroom.

item.description:
Submitted on: Tuesday, 25 October 2016, 2:56 PM

Submitted by: Michael Horembala

HUB APPLICANT AGREEMENT 2016‐2017  

The FSD HUB School System provides students the opportunity to explore their educational programming through on‐line learning.  The FSD Hub allows the students to work at their own pace providing flexibility in their  timetables and the option to continue their education while travelling or working. 

 

Last name: Peterson   First Name: Jamie  Grade: 10

School:

Student email:  Student Phone cell:

Does the student have an IPP(Please attach if relevant)?) No

Parent contact information (Name, phone, email):

Term: Full Year - Complete in June

In which courses has student registered? 
English 10-2
Math 10-3

Students must provide proof of enrollment before entering the HUB. Student will attend classes in the HUB regularly and punctually during the following periods, blocks or times:

 

We have two Jamie Petersons in grade 10. His AB Id is 108461294. He is starting fresh in these cores as he has missed quite a bit of school due to social/emotional challenges. I have talked to Brett at HW and will email Cam to start discussion about Jamie's program and our goals for him. He will be in back to back Hub classes in the afternoons.

Why has the student chosen the hub (ie: Flexibility, travelling, etc)?

What strengths, challenges or other history should the teacher be aware of?

Please attach any relevant documentation here:

The School Act, Section 12 (2011) Part 1, Section 7 states “A student shall conduct his or herself to as to reasonably comply with the following code of conduct:

 

· be diligent in pursuing the student’s studies; 
· attend school regularly and punctually; 
· cooperate fully with everyone authorized by the board to provide education programs and other services; 
· comply with the rules of the school; 
· account to the student’s  teacher for the student’s conduct; 
· respect the rights of others.” 

Failure to meet attendance expectations will result in withdrawal from the course. The student will also 
be responsible for the return of any textbooks or loan items.

The HUB is an online, semi-independent learning environment. I understand that this will require a greater degree of focus and self discipline than in the regular classroom.

· be diligent in pursuing the student’s studies; 
· attend school regularly and punctually; 
· cooperate fully with everyone authorized by the board to provide education programs and other services; 
· comply with the rules of the school; 
· account to the student’s  teacher for the student’s conduct;

The School Act, Section 12 (2011) Part 1, Section 7 states “A student shall conduct his or herself to as to reasonably comply with the following code of conduct:

 

· be diligent in pursuing the student’s studies; 
· attend school regularly and punctually; 
· cooperate fully with everyone authorized by the board to provide education programs and other services; 
· comply with the rules of the school; 
· account to the student’s  teacher for the student’s conduct; 
· respect the rights of others.” 

Failure to meet attendance expectations will result in withdrawal from the course. The student will also 
be responsible for the return of any textbooks or loan items.

The HUB is an online, semi-independent learning environment. I understand that this will require a greater degree of focus and self discipline than in the regular classroom.
